Panorama¶

The Panorama property holds the panorama created from the point cloud, depending on a property (ColorProperty.ColorProperty, CurvatureProperty.CurvatureProperty, etc.). These are created based on SphericalCoordinates.SphericalCoordinates class).

Panorama Property¶

class PanoramaProperty.PanoramaProperty(sphericalCoordinates, rowIndexes=None, columnIndexes=None, panoramaData=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

A panoramic representation of the point set.

Note

For the Scanstation C10 the measurements’ angular resolution for both elevation and azimuth directions:

  • Low: 0.11 deg

  • Medium: 0.057 deg

  • High: 0.028 deg

  • Highest: TO ADD

Attributes

Methods

PanoramaImage¶

Returns the panorama image

Size¶

The image panorama shape

adaptive_smoothing(panoramaImage, phenomena_size, **kwargs)[source]¶

Adaptive smoothing of range image according to another (self) panorama image

Note

The function is implemented similar to other smoothing functions (e.g., cv2.GaussianBlur; cv2.Blur), so different kinds of smoothing functions will be applicable by sending (without if). This means that the function will return computed sigma and ksize according to the average - and they will be returned in the variable.

An adaptive smoothing is implemented as a family of convolution kernels characterized by different \(\sigma\) values where:

\[d(\rho )=\frac{D}{\rho \Delta }\]

with :math: D, the object-space size of the window, and :math: Delta the angular sampling resolution and :math: rho is the measured range.

[Ara13]

Todo

Add optionality for adaptive smoothing for other properties panoramas, where adaptation is according to range information

Parameters

  • phenomena_size – the minimal size of the phenomena that we don’t want to smooth (:math: D above) default: 0.12 m

  • panoramaImage – the image to smooth

Returns

  • smoothed image

  • mean sigma size

  • mean kernel size

Return type

tuple

azimuth_spacing¶

Azimuth angle resolution size

column_indexes¶

The column index of each point

elevation_spacing¶

Elevation angle resolution size

normals(phenomenaSize=0.2, ksize=(5, 5), gradientType='L1', **kwargs)[source]¶

Computing gradients and normals in each direction, via adaptive smoothing according to [Ara13]

Parameters

  • phenomenaSize – phenomena size for adaptive smoothing (default: 0.12 m)

  • ksize – kernel size for gradient computation (default: (5,5))

  • gradientType – ‘L1’ L1 norm of grad(I); ‘L2’ L2-norm of grad(I); ‘LoG’ Laplacian of gaussian (default: ‘L1’)

Optionals

Parameters

  • rangeThresh (float) – scanner’s maximum range

  • smoothing_function – if other smoothing than adaptive is required (e.g. ‘guassianBlur’))

Returns

  • normals: a holding \(n\times m \times 3\) ndarray of the normals in each direction (Nx, Ny, Nz)

  • gradient: gradient in each pixel

  • filtered: range image after adaptive smoothing

  • xyz: points’ list after smoothing, from range image

Return type

tuple

Warning

Implemented for gaussian filtering and adaptive filters. Other adaptations might be needed when using different methods for smoothing.

See also

method NormalsFactory.NormalsFactory.normalsComputation_in_raster()

row_indexes¶

The row index of each point

void_data¶

Value set for void areas

Panorama Factory¶

class PanoramaFactory.PanoramaFactory[source]¶

Creates a panoramic view from point set based on a certain property (e.g. range, intesity, etc.) The panoramic view is stored as a PanoramaProperty object

Methods

classmethod CreatePanorama_byPoints(points, azimuthSpacing=0.057, elevationSpacing=0.057, intensity=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Create a PanoramaProperty object from a point set based on according to range or intensity

Parameters

  • points (PointSet) – The point set to create the panorama from can be either a PointSet, PointSubSet or BaseProperty-derived objects

  • azimuthSpacing (float) – The spacing between two points of the point set in the azimuth direction (scan property)

  • elevationSpacing (float) – The spacing between two points of the point set in the elevation direction

  • intensity – if the pixel’s value should be the intensity value.

  • void_as_mean (bool) – flag to determine the void value as the mean value of the ranges

Returns

panorama_property

Return type

PanoramaProperty

classmethod CreatePanorama_byProperty(pointSet_property, azimuthSpacing=0.057, elevationSpacing=0.057, intensity=False, property_array=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Creates panorama with the property as the values of the pixels.

Parameters

  • pointSet_property – any PointSet property according to which the pixel’s value should be

  • azimuthSpacing – The spacing between two points of the point set in the azimuth direction (scan property)

  • elevationSpacing – The spacing between two points of the point set in the elevation direction

  • property_array – if the values of the property to present cannot be retrieved by a simple getValues()

PanoramaFactory.CreatePanorama_byProperty(curvatureProperty, azimuthSpacing=0.057, elevationSpacing=0.057,
                      intensity=False, property_array=curvatureProperty.k1)
Parameters

  • intensity – if the pixel’s value should be the intensity value.

  • voidData (float) – the number to set where there is no data

  • void_as_mean (bool) – flag to determine the void value as the mean value of the ranges

Returns

panorama_property

Return type

PanoramaProperty
